page.title: 11THE GROWTH OF OUNDLE 2
page.content: .../... 4. Oundle itself is a pretty little town which has been designated a Conservation Area. { There is some concern in the town {that the planners outside the area do {not appear to have noticed this {growth.In a recent letter <27.6.1985> {about accommodation at Prince William {School, Oundle <our school!> the local {M.P. William Powell, wrote :- "Without doubt the problems are getting worse. Numbers in the school are likely to rise in the next few years because the population in East Northamptonshire is likely to grow, whatever the planners may think. This is because of the huge new influx of industry to Corby and the continuing growth of Peterborough _ a fact conveniently ignored at County Hall but the central fact of life in the Oundle area."
